page.title: 14History Of Easton CONT
page.content:
In{1851}a hoard of{bronze coins}were found in the village. They were of {roman origin}and were thought to have been hidden about{AD 340.
In{1934}the few houses that there were, were{scattered all over the {place,}with the church being the {furthest point away.
Now, Easton, although still spread out{has a central point.}At the beginning of the war at least{100 new {houses}were built, and{since 1970}more have been built along{Marlingford Way and{Woodview Close.}This also includes new amenities, a village hall, a garage and a public house.
